result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. NICHOLAS J BUNKER

defendant.name: BUNKER, NICHOLAS J
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt: Letter to the Clerk of Courts dated October 27, 2022 re: billing statements

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on January 9, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

9:43 AM Defendant NICHOLAS J BUNKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Frank Schwartz appeared by video for NICHOLAS J BUNKER.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF49, 22CF162 and 22CF180. 

For cases 22CF162 and 22CF180. Atty Schwartz confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives their readings. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count for each case and as repeaters. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court notes bond has been set in 22CF162. 22CF180 - Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 22CF162 - Court orders bond to remain as is. Atty Schwartz states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearings in both cases. Defendant concurs. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court for 22CF162 and 22CF180 and confirms they mirror their complaints.. Attorney Schwartz acknowledges receipts of the information and waives their reading.  Court will set all cases for Return date January 9, 2023 at 1:00 PM.  OFF THE RECORD 9:50 AM BACK ON THE RECORD 9:50 AM. Same appearances. Atty Schwartz enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant for 22CF162 and 22CF180.

Court adjourned at  9:51 AM.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely - Atty Schwartz
Request for Defense Counsel to Appear Via Zoom
Atty Jesse Schwartz
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:14 PM Defendant NICHOLAS J BUNKER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appears for the defendant by video for 22CF162. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF180 and 22CF162. Court quashes warrant. Atty Nelson is not sure if he will be appointed for this case. ADA makes bond recommendation for 22CF162. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 Cash bond in addition to the last bond. The original $1,000 cash bond will not go toward this bond. Bond for 22CF180 to be set at the next hearing. Adjourned Initial Appearance set for October 18, 2022 at 9:30 AM.
